intro: Alectorolophus deminutus, commonly known as the dwarf larkspur, is a flowering plant belonging to the Ranunculaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, blue to purple flowers and hairy stems. Native to alpine regions of Europe and Asia, it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, showy blooms in early summer. Due to its habitat preferences, it is often found in mountainous environments where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
